Humble Leadership and the Council of Elrond - A Journeyman's Travels

comments.body: {"type":"doc","content":[{"type":"paragraph","content":[{"type":"text","text":"This is the very advice I give to leaders to help foster growth in their subordinates. Allow them to take a crack at the problem. It's cool seeing it as a negotiation tactic for when a difficult answer is the choice that must be made. Thanks for this, and I won't see this scene the same again."}]}]}
comments.body_html: This is the very advice I give to leaders to help foster growth in their subordinates. Allow them to take a crack at the problem. It's cool seeing it as a negotiation tactic for when a difficult answer is the choice that must be made. Thanks for this, and I won't see this scene the same again.

page.title: Sprint Demo as a Software Test - A Journeyman's Travels

comments.body: {"type":"doc","content":[{"type":"paragraph","content":[{"type":"text","text":"Cent percent agreed. Some great feedback can be gathered from demos and those could be leveraged to understand user requirements more closely"}]}]}
comments.body_html: Cent percent agreed. Some great feedback can be gathered from demos and those could be leveraged to understand user requirements more closely

page.title: On the Nature of Scrum Masters - A Journeyman's Travels

comments.body: {"type":"doc","content":[{"type":"paragraph","content":[{"type":"text","text":"After coming to Improving I was obsessed for a while with the line between Scrum (or Kanban) and Agile. How interesting that the Scrum Master role has such an Agile job description! Maybe they should be renamed the Agile Master!"}]}]}
comments.body_html: After coming to Improving I was obsessed for a while with the line between Scrum (or Kanban) and Agile. How interesting that the Scrum Master role has such an Agile job description! Maybe they should be renamed the Agile Master!
